These pages give you brief instructions on how to install `R` and `RStudio` onto your own machine.

Note that to use `RStudio`, you first need to have installed `R`.

#### Installing `R`

1. Go to [http://www.r-project.org](http://www.r-project.org).
2. Click on [`download R`](https://cran.r-project.org/mirrors.html).
3. Choose a mirror. It is recommended that you choose either one of the `0-Cloud` or `UK` mirrors.
4. Click on `Download R for ...` depending on your operating system and follow the instructions.


#### Installing RStudio

1. Go to [https://posit.co/](https://posit.co/).
2. Go to `Free & Open Source` → `Analyze & Explore` →  `RStudio IDE`.
3. Click on `Download RStudio Desktop` under `Open Source Edition`.
4. Download the installer appropriate for your operating system.
